thread.title: Seattle Seahawks running back Fred Jackson to team a day after crashing car: Drive safely
thread.title_full: Seattle Seahawks running back Fred Jackson to team a day after crashing car: Drive safely | The Seattle Times

author: Jayson Jenks
title: Seattle Seahawks running back Fred Jackson to team a day after crashing car: Drive safely
text:
RENTON — Seattle Seahawks coach Pete Carroll said running back Fred Jackson addressed his car accident with the entire team.
“I just wanted to make sure that he told what happened so they all knew for a heads up for everybody else to keep your eye on the road and do things right and drive carefully and protect the people around you and ourselves,” Carroll said (see video below). “It was just a good opportunity to make the point.”
Jackson was involved in a one-car accident about a quarter-mile from the Seahawks’ facility in Renton on Tuesday afternoon. Jackson was not injured in the crash, and Carroll said Jackson will play Thursday night against the 49ers. A spokesman for the Renton police said there would be no further investigation into the accident but added that Jackson could receive “a ticket for inattention, a minor infraction.”
Carroll said Jackson’s accident wouldn’t a distraction. “Just very fortunate nobody was hurt,” Carroll said, “and we’re lucky in that regard.”
Most Read Stories Fugitive felon, linked to motorcycle gang, captured in Lynnwood after 4-month hunt Seahawks’ Fred Jackson crashes car; Cops say no evidence of drag racing Oregon alum to abusive Huskies fans: This rivalry doesn't need you Loss of middle-income jobs seen as threat to region’s competitiveness Seattle Seahawks Monday injury report: Nine players sit out Unlimited Digital Access. $1 for 4 weeks. Jackson’s accident comes a week after fullback Derrick Coleman was involved in a two-car accident in Bellevue, leaving the driver of the other car injured. Coleman was arrested on suspicion of vehicular assault and hit-and-run, but charges haven’t been filed.
Coleman was suspended by the Seahawks but has since been reinstated. Carroll said Coleman won’t play Thursday because of a concussion suffered in the accident.
Carroll said he was “disappointed” in the Coleman and Jackson accidents.
“We talked about it today with the whole group,” Carroll said. “How that happened within a short time I don’t know. And Fred talked to the team as well just to give everybody the heads up to make sure that we’re doing the right thing and not making any more mistakes.”
Seattle coach Pete Carroll talks about Fred Jackson Wednesday. Jayson Jenks : 206-464-8277 or jjenks@seattletimes.com ; on Twitter: @jaysonjenks . Jayson Jenks covers the Seahawks for the Seattle Times. He also provides coverage of other Seattle-area teams throughout the year.
